sentences.sContent: All passengers must wear seat belts.
sentences.sCn: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。

sentences.sContent: It’s getting late. I really must go.
sentences.sCn: 天晚了，我真的必须走了。

sentences.sContent: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
sentences.sCn: 要启动引擎，绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。

sentences.sContent: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
sentences.sCn: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

sentences.sContent: ...Don’t run blindly if you must move...
...so Patihis suggests that something must have caused them to think so much about their past...
...What must applicants do in their personal statements...
...the gift money must be put in the red envelope instead of the white envelope...
...each students must reach his or her own conclusion...
...I must say I agree with you about there being bad feelings in the works...
...we all must pay our share for the services that make our lives comfortable...
...He says he must grow different kinds of tea if he is to survive...
...Then you must complete this form and pay a fee...

synos.tran: 必须，一定；可以，应当；很可能

phrases.pCn: 一定（对过去事实肯定的推测）
必定做了…（表示对过去的推测）

words.tran: 集合；检阅；点名册；集合人员
召集；对…进行点名；使振作

trans.tranOther: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order
